Job Description:
Job Description Summary

The role is the customer facing role for the meeting cardiologist & radiologists. The job require generating sales for the PDX products, collecting market data points & reporting the same

This is a direct customer facing role.

Sales Trainee will be responsible for Udaipur & Jodhpur territory and build customer connect in a large geography (covering main locations like Bhilwara Kota Udaipur etc with a radius of 250 kms plus besides smaller districts) with business potential of around INR 9 crores plus ($ 1.2 million) annually and existing base of INR 7 crore plus with more than 120 plus customer base.

TM would be focusing on business development in territory, enhancing profitability with improved Product mix, strengthening channel for customer service besides driving marketing campaigns and regular customer coverage.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

  • within a geographic area responsible for selling product(s), services, parts, solutions, or projects

  • Broadening knowledge of own sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups to execute policy/strategy. Still acquiring higher level knowledge and skills.

  • Basic understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. Good understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.

  • May have some autonomy to make decisions within a defined framework. Resolves issues in situations that require commercial knowledge and judgment within established procedures. Consults more senior team members for issues outside of defined instructions/parameters.

  • A job at this level requires good interpersonal skills. Communication with direct colleagues and the business about design and coordination services rendered. For customer facing roles, develops strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between customer and GE. Explains technical information to others.

Required Qualifications

  • This role requires 2+ years of experience in Sales in Radiology and Cardiology segment.

  • Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's/Master's degree from an accredited university or college

Desired Characteristics

  • Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.

Job Description

角色与职责

  • 向合作伙伴和分销商销售或通过其进行销售。可能包括渠道销售支持和渠道开发职责。
  • 对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群有深入的了解。利用先前的经验和获得的商业专业知识来执行政策/策略。
  • 深入理解关键业务驱动力；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。深入了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。
  • 大多数决策都在规定的框架内，但是对于项目、产品线、市场、销售过程或客户的最终决策具有一定的自主权。利用先前的经验和在职培训来解决简单的任务。拥有解决问题所需的技术技能和分析思维。可以使用自己团队以外的多个内部资源来做出决定。
  • 此级别的职位可能由个人贡献者担任，且其具有成熟的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。为新团队成员提供非正式指导。在简单的情况下向其他人解释复杂的信息。

基本资格

  • 该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）

所需特性

  • 优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

As a Lead Sales Specialist you'll be responsible for activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives
Operates with some autonomy but are typically subject to standard sales practices and procedures. The role is subject to regular review of sales results. Some judgment may be required but this is typically with guidance. May be responsible for medium-sized sales territories.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our purpose is to create a world where healthcare has no limits. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Essential responsibilities:

  • Sales force effectiveness, productivity analysis, allocation of resources and territory coverage, sales incentives, Salesforce CRM platform and tools, lead for commercial planning and forecasting, Inquiry to Order (ITO) processes, ITO lead for business reviews. Cleans and maintains data in Commercial and other core systems (CRMs, SFDC, ERPs, etc.).
  • Developing in-depth knowledge of sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups. Uses prior experience and acquired commercial expertise to execute policy/strategy.
  • In-depth understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. In-depth understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.
  • Most decisions are within a defined framework, but some autonomy in the final decisions for a project, product line, market, sales process or customers. Uses prior experience and on-the-job training to solve straightforward tasks. Has access to technical skills and analytic thinking required to solve problems. May use multiple internal sources outside of own team to arrive at decisions.
  • A job at this level is likely to be an individual contributor, with proven interpersonal skills. Communication with direct colleagues and the business about design and coordination services rendered. Provides informal guidance to new team members. Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations.

Requirements / Qualifications:

  • This role requires advanced experience in the Sales & Sales Operations.
  • Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college
  • Deep knowledge in supply chain, logistics and export processes
  • French - fluent, English - advanced
  • Organized and structured person
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.
  • Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.
  • Established project management skills.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Customer facing staff responsible for winning business. Executes standard sales tasks and typically subject to instructions and work routines. There is latitude to rearrange the sequence to complete task/duties based on changing work situations. May be responsible for targeted clients, stable regions, and/or small/medium sales territories.
Supports distributors on maximizing services sales opportunities.
Delivers service revenues objectives (across Service offers portfolio: Labor, Parts, Accessories, Solutions).

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities :

Basic understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. Good understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.
May have some autonomy to make decisions within a defined framework. Resolves issues in situations that require commercial knowledge and judgment within established procedures. Consults more senior team members for issues outside of defined instructions/parameters.
Within a geographic area responsible for selling product(s), services, parts, solutions, or projects.

  • Captures assigned service sales opportunities to achieve and exceed touch rate, revenue and annual pricing increases targets in assigned product line and/or customer accounts.

  • Implements proactive call schedule to increase sales growth.

  • Generates proposals, prepares quotations, and demonstrates services value to assigned CP/customers.

  • Prioritizes selling time to build and maintain a balanced funnel of prospects to generate sales, achieves account penetration and drives capture rate in collaboration with channel partners.

  • Develops and maintains consultative sales relationships with all key-buying influences in each account. Utilizes installed base information, sales and service reports/databases, new leads and cold-calling efforts.

  • Tracks call outcomes and opportunities through designated tracking processes and/or customer relationship management tools.

  • Supports and partners with field sales and service personnel in their efforts to sell service value.

  • Follows up on targeted marketing campaigns and maximizes incremental revenue.

  • Ensures seamless teamwork with the Equipment Sales, Product Services Sales specialists, Service Account Leaders, Marketing, Commercial Operations and Imaging-U/S-PCS Devices Commercial leader to maximize all sales potential.

  • Specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups.

  • Develop an effective commercial strategy to ensure sales service growth in partnership with distributors in the French-speaking Africa zone.

  • Align the region's strategy with that of GEHC International and lead initiatives to promote service solutions. With a strong focus on the segments: Contracts, On-Demand Service, Upgrades and Digital.

  • Strong commercial awareness, and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including management of resources.

  • Interprets simple internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services. Stays informed of industry trends that may inform work.

Required profile:

A job at this level requires good interpersonal skills.

Communication with direct colleagues and the business about design and coordination services rendered.

For customer facing roles, develops strong customer relationships and serves as the interface between customer and GE HealthCare.

Explains technical information to others.


Desired Characteristics
Strong oral and written communication skills.

Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

As a Customer-Facing Sales Representative, you will be responsible for engaging with clients to secure new business opportunities. You will operate with a degree of autonomy while adhering to established sales practices and procedures. Your performance will be regularly reviewed based on sales outcomes. Some discretion may be necessary, typically with guidance provided. Your responsibilities may include managing medium-sized sales territories. Job Title: Region Sales Director, Image Guided Systems
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

The Regional Sales Director set’s the sales strategy and manages the sales activities within a geographic area for the Interventional/Image Guided Systems (IGS) for GE HealthCare. Proactively defines & implements the sales strategy and leads a team of sales managers, account executives, and sales professionals to execute the strategy. The position is responsible for developing strong relationships and improved outcomes for customers as well as market and order visibility, market share, and profitability.

Job Description

The Regional Sales Director set’s the sales strategy and manages the sales activities within a geographic area for the Interventional/Image Guided Systems (IGS) for GE HealthCare. Proactively defines & implements the sales strategy and leads a team of sales managers, account executives, and sales professionals to execute the strategy. The position is responsible for developing strong relationships and improved outcomes for customers as well as market and order visibility, market share, and profitability.

Essential Responsibilities:
The position plays a critical role in executing big deals, business outcomes, and customer solutions. This role is a key part of the division leadership team, partnering with the division service sales and service delivery leaders to drive customer satisfaction and business growth.
•    Sets the overall sales strategy for a geographic area (“region”)
•    Manages overall sales revenue, margin, cost targets, orders goals and other financial goals in a manner that achieves business targets; drives financial accountability throughout the organization to ensure all targets for the organization are met
•    Leads a large and experienced sales team, selling products across GE Healthcare’s vast portfolio
•    Mobilizes and motivates the sales team to fulfill GE Healthcare’s strategic business goals; leads team to develop sales funnel for growth
•    Influences the allocation of employee resources across the market to ensure the best alignment of market opportunities and sales professionals
•    Demonstrate the ability to generate business opportunities that leverage the suite of GE Healthcare’s offerings in the marketplace
•    Establishes and fosters customer relationships that have significant impact on the organization
•    Builds long term relationship with customers; provides leadership and direction in crucial customer interactions
•    Strengthens GEHC’s external image
•    Effectively utilizes key industry information and market knowledge to gain competitive advantage in marketplace
•    Accountable for positive leadership and culture of the region through ongoing direction, coaching, and career development of leaders
•    Leads and cultivates a culture of integrity and boundaryless collaboration
•    Collaborates with leaders across GE in order to ensure that the best practices for the organization are identified and adopted
•    Ensure all quality and compliance goals are met and that a culture of compliance is pervasive throughout the organization
•    Promotes a safe working environment and ensures compliance with applicable EHS policies and procedures Quality Specific Goals


Qualifications/Requirements:
•    BA/BS degree
•    10+ years of successful capital sales/marketing leadership experience with 5+ years of successful senior level sales management and general management experience
•    Sales and service commercial leadership experience
•    Ability to develop and execute multiple priorities and approaches to meet objectives
•    Enterprise solutions mindset and strategic trade off experience
•    Exceptional interpersonal skills
•    Demonstrated ability to lead a team that is accountable for financial commitments to a business unit
•    Exceptional business acumen
•    Ability to negotiate complex and strategic agreements
•    Knowledge and experience with large and complex sales and marketing processes
•    Excellent communication, influencing, and team-building skills. Must be highly skilled at written and verbal communication both inside the company and with external customers
•    Ability to influence and drive change cross-functionally in a highly matrixed environment
•    Healthcare/MedTech Industry experience, preferred experience in interventional cardiology, EP, IR/Hybrid OR
•    Willingness and ability to travel
•    Strong People Leader skills to drive a highly effective, inclusive team

Job Title: Product Sales Specialist, General Imaging Ultrasound
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

As the Product Sales Specialist General Imaging Ultrasound in the Northeast territory, you will be responsible for creating and winning sales opportunities for GI Ultrasound products, solutions, and services by calling on radiology customers. You will be a sales expert for your assigned products and are expected to be able to differentiate GE’s offerings and convey compelling value proposition to successfully close sales. You will partner with existing accounts including large, complex, strategic, or tactically important accounts. GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our purpose is to create a world where healthcare has no limits. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Responsibilities

  • Generating proposals, preparing sales quotations and presentations, planning customer meetings, and demonstrating equipment capabilities on GI products in assigned territory.

  • Maintaining satisfactory after-sale relationships. Penetrating competitive accounts and communicating current market intelligence back to the business, along with field concerns, issues and requirements.

  • Providing leadership in market analysis and development/execution of strategies and action plans to drive GI Ultrasound sales.

  • Prospecting for new customers and business in addition to growing and maintaining our existing customer portfolio.

  • Annual and quarterly achievement of multiple sales and revenue targets.

  • Development of long-term customer relationships coupled with the ability to identify and capitalize on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs.

Qualifications

  • Bachelors Degree & 3 years of experience; OR High School Diploma/GED & 5 years of experience; OR Bachelors Degree & a graduate of GE HealthCare CLP

  • Demonstrated experience presenting complex information both verbally and written to decision makers.

  • Must live in the territory and be willing to travel within the territory. (Territory: MA, RI. CT, NH, VT)

Desired Characteristics

  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as with a team

  • Capital equipment sales experience

  • Healthcare sales experience.

Job Title: Commercial Finance Analyst (USCAN National Accounts & Indirect Sales Channels)
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

The United States and Canada (USCAN) National Accounts & Indirect Sales Channels Commercial Finance Analyst will support the analysis, reporting, and planning of total National Accounts and Indirect Sales Channels financials focusing on external commissions, orders, sales, margin analysis, planning, and reporting by segment. Additionally, will support key Business Operating Mechanisms such as MOR reviews, operating reviews and business reporting mechanisms. This role reports to the USCAN National Accounts & Indirect Sales Channels Finance Manager and closely partners with the USCAN Product CFO, Product Finance team, USCAN Indirect Channels GMs & their teams across all 3 business segments (Imaging, PCS, Ultrasound), the Nationals & Strategic Accounts leadership team, External Channel Partners, and other cross functional stakeholders to drive robust operating mechanisms for external commissions, growth and margin expansion.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Ownership of the monthly variable compensation paid to indirect sales channel partners across all 3 equipment business segments (Imaging, PCS, Ultrasound) and disputes management in partnership with cross-functional stakeholders.

  • Support P&L estimates (QMI), planning (LTS, Budget for both internal and external stakeholders) and drive closing, audits & reporting communication (quarter close, MOR reviews) in partnership with Product Finance, USCAN FP&A, USCAN Controllership and Variable Compensation team.

  • Ownership of orders & sales reporting & Annual Budget, cost (SG&A) & margin analytics for both P&Ls, support productivity initiatives and margin expansion including during commercial contract renewal negotiations.

  • Help drive automation projects and Lean initiatives to drive operational and financial efficiencies in partnership with cross-functional stakeholders (Commercial operations, Analytics team).

  • Develop & maintain National Account level franchise margin analysis model used for deal decisioning & leadership reviews.

  • Support the USCAN National Accounts & Indirect Sales Channels Finance Manager, Indirect Sales Channels GMs and National Accounts GMs with area specific analytics & requests.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or business administration.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description Summary
Lead a remote, diverse, and inclusive team of Ultrasound Order Management Specialists located in both India and the United States. This leadership position is a key position that will partner with horizontal team members, such as controllership, cash, revenue, fulfillment, manufacturing, and commercial leaders to compliantly maximize orders, sales, and cash. This critical role will help define and lead the strategic plan to ensure we are positioned well to support the anticipated growth in coming years by ensuring processes are sound, documented and delivering timely and quality outputs. Additionally, this person will be responsible for activities and processes that help the organization achieve business objectives and by contributing to key initiatives not only within Order Operations, but also within upstream and downstream spaces where we count heavily on cross functional inputs and deliver outputs.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities
  • Direct responsibility for a Team of Order Management Specialists, located within the United States and India; Ensure compliant progression of orders from order entry to transfer/revenue recognition, while supporting accurate invoicing to customers
  • Develop a culture that embraces a diversity and inclusiveness across team members, leadership team, field teams and other functions
  • Build on existing Leadership Standard Work around operational Key Performance Indicators to ensure order quality and team efficiency. Use operational metrics, including Takt Time and andons/alerts to drive daily work and actions with the team as well as create a shared vision and drive process improvement, supported with regular Genba walks ensuring standard work and escalation paths are being followed.
  • Leverage Takt Time to analyze Customer Demand on key processes and allocate resources appropriately to level load and meet demand; Defining and implementing surge strategies to meet agreed upon Service Level Agreements for order operational tasks.
  • Function as a subject matter expert on order management policies and procedures; Partnering with controllership, contracting, and pricing to ensure quotes and orders are compliant with contractual terms and conditions, controllership guidelines, and marketing promotions
  • Actively participate in organization tool and manpower resource management planning.
  • Coach team members and provide performance management to a team of order management specialists including periodic 1:1 touch points and end of year summary touch points.
  • Collaborate with peers across other Order Management Segment teams to execute multi-business deals and cross P&L improvement initiatives.
  • Lead training for new and current Order Management team members, both locally and remote, and help maintain and update standard operating procedures.
  • Partner with our Order Operations Lean Leader to drive lean operations by ensuring standard work is being followed through regular Genba walks, while applying lean methodologies (5 Why’s, Fishbone Analysis, etc.) and problem solving assessments when tracing causes to an observable problems and variations.
  • Uses some judgment and has some ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated, day-to-day problems with projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, or customers within a compliant fashion.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Mgt or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 2 years of work experience in an operational execution role (team supervisor, commercial operations, etc.)
  • Ability to lead & set direction for a remote team including demonstrated ability to motivate, influence and problem solve.
  • Ability to flex schedule (including weekends) during peak periods (quarter close)
  • Ability to prioritize information for decision making. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking to solve problems.
  • A job at this level requires strong interpersonal skills and can act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
  • Ability to explain complex information; Influencing skills with a proven track record to bring team members to consensus around topics.
  • Ability to convey performance expectations in a clear and motivating way, and at times will handle sensitive issues.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.

Desired Characteristics

  • Knowledge of GEHC order operations processes and requirements
  • Previous direct or indirect management experience
  • Working knowledge of GEHC eOM and MyOrders applications
  • Prior experience in a sales related industry or transactional environment
  • Proven track record building inclusive, diverse and collaborative teams
  • Experience working successfully within a highly regulated team/industry
  • Experience with ERP applications
  • Knowledge of GEHC commercial operations processes and systems
  • Excellent strategic & tactical execution skill sets
  • Ability to drive change and continuous improvement
  • Lean and/or Six Sigma experience

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Lead a large team in Orders and Sales Operations, processes & mechanisms for the clinical accessories and Blood Pressure Cuff segments.  Coordinate and lead the growth, financial performance, NPI deployment, etc. for Product Sales Specialist’s and all distributor activities and relationships in the U.S. and Canada.
  • Partner with business leaders, strategic/Product Sales Specialist’s staff and global operations/marketing to drive operating performance, and act as a champion for strategic initiatives within the segment for U.S. and Canada growth.  Lead with a Lean discipline to include KPI development, management and positive change.
  • Partner with the U.S. and Canada and Patient Care Solutions Operations teams (i.e. Deal structuring, contracting, order management, proposals, variable compensation) as well as Service, Marketing, Commercial Excellence and Global Supply Chain to improve sales team efficiency and effectiveness. Cultivate partnerships with Value Creation leaders and their teams to build consistent strategies for multi-modality projects and cross-P&L business events.
  • Drive operational excellence processes throughout the Product Sales Specialist’s, strategic, distributor and global teams to ensure contract compliance, customer satisfaction and streamlined business efficiencies.
  • Effectively lead a large team of cross-functional remote operations employees and contractors, determine clear roles & responsibilities, identify and action development needs to ensure superior business, customer support and business growth.
  • Enable collaborative culture and drive organization to improve customer/client satisfaction levels and responsiveness.
  • Develop metrics, dashboards, data portals, Power BI etc. to measure progress, build tools to make commercial teams more effective, and to make collaborative teams more efficient.  Drive utilization of Sales Force and the U.S. and Canada sales process to develop forecasting tools and Operating Plan attainment strategies for commercial implementation.
  • Ensure data analytics drive decision making and Identify opportunities to improve visibility, win-rate and share performance across our P&L and U.S. and Canada.
  • Drive process simplification and best practices across Blood Pressure Cuffs, Clinical Accessories, Services, Network Design & Integration, and other Patient Care Solutions segments.
  • Support any internal and external Quality audits and closure of audit findings, Support the EHS program and the follow up (EHS contractor safety / EHS training fulfillments)

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree and 5+ years’ experience in sales operations, forecasting, financial reporting, contracting, management and or operations leadership, OR, High School Diploma/GED and minimum of ten years financial or operational work experience including developing forecasts & operating plans, leading commercial operations and contracts, and creating and leading business reviews.
  • Experience establishing strategic imperatives & initiatives in order to ensure the fulfillment of business requirements, and to optimize business performance both operationally and financial, manage all rebates, pricing, admin fees, etc. with business partners, and GPO’s for the segment.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead and influence a team within a large, complex and matrixed commercial organization.
  • Ability to influence and collaborate with senior level management teams.
  • Demonstrated written and oral communication skills, with strong coaching and mentoring experience.

Desired Characteristics

  • Demonstrated analytic skills: able to clearly link financial results to operational performance drivers, generate alternatives and drive positive change.
  • Clear thinking / problem solving: successfully led cross-functional projects/process improvement within operations/finance function involving process improvement; able to quickly grasp new ideas.
  • Leadership experience: has five years’ experience leading team members, balancing execution through others with inclusiveness, leveraging expertise, clear thinking, imagination, and external focus.
  • Excellent communication skills: experience working across multiple levels (including executive level), functions and regions; able to clearly communicate complex financial information in a easy to understand manner; able to deliver message effectively verbally and in writing.
  • Solid PC skills: experience with financial systems/applications (i.e.: Oracle, SAP, COGNOS, Business Objects, etc.), strong Excel skills in data compilation and aggregation (i.e. pivot tables, VLookup, and Macros).
  • Adaptable/flexible: being open to change (positive or negative) in response to new information, different or unexpected circumstances, and/or to work in ambiguous situations.
  • Integrity: Accepting and adhering to high moral, ethical, and personal values in decisions, communications, actions, and when dealing with others.
  • Trained and/or certified in process improvement methodology such as LEAN or Six Sigma.
  • Masters’ degree in Business Administration, or similar discipline.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

This role will be responsible for selling the company’s products and services to and maintaining relationships with strategic Cardiovascular Ultrasound (CVUS) competitive accounts and strategic GE HealthCare customers nationally. The Segment is viewed as an expert by the company and in the field, and will lead efforts around sales training and coaching, building strategic solutions, and driving product lifecycle excellence.

Job Description

HIRE needs to be in territory. OHIO, PA, MICHIGAN, NEBRASKA, WISCONSIN

IS NOT FULLY REMOTE. HAS TO LIVE IN TERRITORY

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Expand Cardiovascular Ultrasound (CVUS) expertise and competitiveness of the GEHC CVUS sales team, including coaching, mentoring, and training efforts

  • Drive Orders and Revenue results in defined geography, by ensuring effectiveness of CVUS sales and clinical team.

  • Ensure CVUS sales and clinical teams are actively driving growth in all sub-segments, including Interventional/Structural Heart, Echo Lab, Pediatrics, and Physician Office.

  • Develop and implement a business plan for Key Break-in Accounts aimed at achieving and exceeding our financial commitments to the business

  • Work seamlessly with all Market Leaders, PSS’s, Account Managers, and Clinical Applications to develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GEHC Ultrasound businesses, products & services.

  • Identify, develop, and support CVUS Key Opinion Leaders.

  • Leverage PSS’s, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation.

  • Develop and implement market strategies with CVUS and Region Teams to achieve results through effective project proposals, negotiations and contracts.

  • Maintain a high level of technical and commercial competence on relevant products, technologies, and services.

  • Prepare and participate in business reviews/forecasts with senior leadership to ensure a constant flow of accurate information.

  • Maintain an awareness of market dynamics and healthcare trends and ensure that this information is collected and made available to senior leadership.

  • Contribute to development of product messaging, value propositions, and CVUS solutions.

Required Qualifications

  • This is a remote field positions located in the USA near a major airport to facilitate heavy travel requirements.

  • Bachelors Degree and at least one of the following core experiences: 10+ years of consultative sales experience including strategic selling and negotiation, or 5+ years in progressively larger formal leadership roles working in a complex technical environment.

  • 5+ Years of experience in the Cardiac Care Area space, with specific background selling and/or supporting Cardiovascular Ultrasound Products and Solutions.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Demonstrated success in complex strategic/enterprise sales at CXO level.

  • A proven track-record of achieving and exceeding sales targets, and a desire to grow new business.

  • Experience understanding customer needs and business drivers and using this knowledge to develop account plans and proven ability to influence ideas and drive results.

  • Proven key account management and project planning skills.

  • Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills.

  • Proven track record of relationship building skills.

  • High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact.

  • Demonstrated ability to work in a highly matrixed organization

  • Willingness to travel at least 75% within your specified geographic region with overnight stays depending on geography and business need.

  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with healthcare stakeholders within hospital, physician practice and imaging center account service lines to identify qualified leads, grow market share and increase revenue, and reduce customer attrition.

  • Demonstrated history of meeting or exceeding sales quotas

Job Title: USCAN Services OTR, Team Manager - Waukesha WI - Remote
Job Description:
Job Description Summary

GEHealthCare is in search of new leader to join our USCAN Services Order-to-Remittance (OTR) team.

This job is a remote opportunity.

By creating strong working relationships, you will influence various service and commercial business functions, driving continuous improvement in service contract management, invoicing, and sales support.

This position is responsible for the direct management and daily “on the floor” support for our Service Sales Operations Specialists (SSOS) team. The OTR Team Manager acts as the leader and owner for all policies, processes, metrics and customer escalations related to contract processing (adds, deletes, modifications), contract and system entitlements, activations, and invoicing in Siebel and other systems as applicable. In this role, you will work cross-functionally with key stakeholders to execute strategic and tactical projects, including people, process, and tool enhancements to enable the growth of our USCAN Services business at GE HealthCare.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Objectives:

  • Motivate and inspire team of sales support colleagues to work collaboratively in pursuit of delivering growth and bottom-line results in an evolving team environment.

  • Cultivate a positive, family-oriented team culture where colleagues feel valued, supported, and engaged in a virtual working environment.

  • Adapt to changing situations and make strategic decisions to ensure the team’s success.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Manage, coach, and mentor a team of service sales support colleagues towards achieving company goals and objectives.

  • Lead closing activities during peak business periods with operations and field teams to ensure business goals are achieved timely, accurately, and compliantly.

  • Ensure team compliance with company policies and procedures, and our standard operating procedures for all applicable processes.

  • Responsible for coordinating resources to support successful and timely audits for internal and external auditors.

  • Utilize metrics to monitor quality, efficiency, and KPI's to optimize resources and guide individuals to meet their goals.

  • Generate reports on team performance and provide regular updates to senior management.

  • Recognize and reward superior performance; provide feedback and encourage team members’ professional development by providing opportunities for training and growth.

  • Retain and attract outstanding talent to the organization.

  • Identify and execute simplification and standardization projects across the contract management team that will lead to greater contract and billing accuracy.

  • Ensure appropriate engagement and clear collaboration and communication across all constituent groups and technology teams.

  • Provide operational support to cross-functional stakeholders to implement systemic solutions and maximize operational efficiency.

  • Leverage effective change management and change acceleration processes in executing enhancements to contract management and sales support.

Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

  • Minimum 3 years of order management, commercial, and/or operations experience.

  • Ability to lead and set direction for a team, including demonstrated ability to motivate, influence, and solve problems.

  • Commercial and business operations expertise.

  • Demonstrated experience leading teams where coaching, mentoring, and teaching skills have been utilized.

  • Demonstrated experience driving change and utilizing Change Acceleration skills.

  • Aptitude and success in fostering solid, value-based relationships with internal and external customers.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office products, i.e., Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

As the Regional Clinical Leader (RCL), you have overall responsibility for accelerating the growth of GE Healthcare’s imaging agent, Cerianna.

In this commercial role, you will sell, provide clinical and technical support, and deliver in-service education presentations to customers in large and small group settings. You will have a quarterly quota to attain. You will prepare and deliver business reviews. Cross-functionally, you will work closely with sales, marketing, and other internal stakeholders. You will stay on-label in all discussions, education, and training, both internal and external customers.

This position is based in California. You must live within the geography and near a major airport.

Our Pharmaceutical Diagnostics (PDx) business is the number one global supplier of contrast media and molecular imaging agents used to enhance medical imaging exams. Used throughout all major disease area diagnostic and treatment pathways, PDx products support three patients every second around the world. This role is for the Oncology division and will work directly with the commercial team for additional expertise on breast cancer and clinical adoption of Cerianna.

Oncology is a priority care area for us where we see significant growth potential for the use of Molecular Imaging to enable precision oncology. We have a foundation of established proprietary products and now plan to build on this significantly with the launch of Cerianna and a growing innovative pipeline of products that will enable better diagnostic decisions and clinical outcomes in oncology. We are also partnering with Pharma Companies and the research community to create companion diagnostic solutions that support patient selection and monitoring through the development of immuno-oncology therapies. This new role will be critical to ensuring the successful implementation of our strategy.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Strategically work with Oncology Account Manager to identify key accounts for development.

  • Collaborate closely with Oncology Account Manager to grow business in assigned accounts.

  • Plan, coordinate, and implement on-label clinical education presentations and discussions with HCPs to ensure clinical acceptance of Cerianna.

  • Follow up of prior educated customers to ensure long term acceptance and continued optimal use of Cerianna.

  • Identify key areas of growth potential for staff and physicians that increase adoption of Cerianna.

  • Maintain knowledge of current trends and development in breast cancer to support customers as product capabilities are developed; continuously increase knowledge of new developments to perform as a subject matter expert.

  • Assist with product training for sales team as well as other internal stakeholders.

  • Provide key Voice of Customer feedback to commercial leadership and key internal stakeholders to assist in continuous improvement.

  • Create and present quarterly business plans that demonstrate how to achieve quarterly quotas.

  • Develop and maintain relationships with Cerianna Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) in assigned geography.

  • Document account activities in Salesforce.com platform

  • Represent and assist at local, regional, or national trade shows/meetings, as required.

  • Maintain all vendor hospital credentialing.

  • Follow GE Travel and Expense policies and submit expense reports in a timely manner.

  • Demonstrate GE leadership behaviors in all interactions with internal and external customers.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in scientific or clinical discipline

  • 1-2 years’ experience in clinical practice/patient management/research in oncology- breast oncology preferred

  • Teaching ability: present complex material in comprehensible terms, present a professional image

  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States and live in posted location

  • Able to travel extensively in assigned region, including overnight travel up to 60-70% of the time. Ideally located to major metropolitan airport in the *** portion of the US.

  • Valid motor vehicle license

Desired Characteristics

  • An advanced degree is preferred (PhD, Pharm D, MD, DO, Advanced Nursing Degree, Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies, MS, or equivalent Preferred Knowledge/Skills

  • Demonstrate effective sales and presentation skills in diverse settings from one-on-one to formal large group situations, in-person and virtually

    • Ability to work independently with little or no direct supervision

    • Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills

    • Advanced MS Office skills to develop effective reports, spreadsheets, and presentations

    • Creative, flexible, and well-organized

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

As an Imaging Account Manager, you’ll own and drive the sales strategy of the GE HealthCare diagnostic imaging portfolio at accounts within the Central and Southern Indiana.

GE Healthcare is a place with big impact. We unlock opportunities for our people, our customers, and their patients, turning big ideas into realities that advance global healthcare.

Responsible for activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives. The role is subject to regular review of sales results.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with healthcare stakeholders within hospital, physician practice and imaging center account service lines (Radiology, Cardiology, Oncology, OR & Women’s Health) in order to identify qualified leads, grow market share and increase revenue, and reduce customer attrition.
  • Deliver on quarterly & annual orders and revenue sales targets; maximize profit margin on equipment and service contract sales.
  • Leverage diagnostic imaging product knowledge in MRI, Xray, CT, Interventional Radiology & Cardiology, Mammography, Nuclear Medicine & PET-C to drive funnel growth for the region.
  • Demonstrate expertise in customers’ installed base and develop technology & capital plans that map with their annual budget process.
  • Collaborate with the account community team to drive closure with site visits and co-developed negotiation strategies.
  • Reduce cycle time by leveraging Salesforce.com (CRM tool) to track customer and account activity, to map visibility and drive market share, and to prioritize sales funnel.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 5 years of commercial experience supporting the healthcare industry OR an associate degree with a minimum of 10 years experience
  • Demonstrated experience presenting complex information both verbally and written to decision makers.
  • Must live in and be willing to travel within the territory. Central and Southern Indiana.
  • 3+ years of outside sales experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in the Healthcare industry selling capital diagnostic imaging equipment OR technical Imaging product knowledge
  • Ability to thrive in a matrix sales organization
  • Curious learner able to stay abreast of industry, products and healthcare trends
  • Desire to learn and adapt to win in an evolving environment
  • Strong evidence of negotiating complex contracts at the c-suite level

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Job Description

Essential Functions / Responsibilities:

Support sixteen field facing MR product sales specialists.  Travel to meet with radiologists and technologists in their hospitals or imaging centers throughout the Eastern half of the United States as in-person image reviews and post processing demonstrations are required.  Additional travel is required to support MRI scanning sessions at our headquarters location in Wisconsin to optimize protocols for hospital turnovers as well as in support of local and national show site locations.  Tasked with increasing orders, sales, margin, and share through world-class clinical consulting, strong customer relationships, and educational support for regional sales team, local/national “show sites” and regional customer base. Exceptional clinical presentation skills and specialty clinical qualifications including advanced level MRI scanning capabilities (Advanced Neuro, Cardiac, Body, MSK and Vascular), protocol optimization, advanced level post processing with specific knowledge and demonstration capabilities for third party and MR AW Server applications.  Develop an in-depth knowledge of the sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes and customer groups. Able to explain complex MRI information to others in simplified straightforward ways.

Qualifications / Requirements:

Position requires an Associate’s degree, or foreign degree equivalent, in Applied Science, Radiology, Health Science, Radiologic Technology or related field and 5 years of experience in a related occupation in a MRI clinical setting.  The position also requires: 5 years of experience in clinical presentation and specialty clinical experience including advanced level MRI scanning capabilities as well as experience in advanced MRI post processing; 5 years of experience operating GE MRI scanners; and ARRT (American Registry of Radiologic Technologists) Certification (or foreign degree equivalent). 50-75% travel is required to support MR product specialists/field sales representatives, and to meet with radiologists and technologists in their hospitals or imaging centers throughout the Eastern half of the United States as in-person image reviews and post processing demonstrations are required, and also to support MRI scanning sessions at company headquarters location in Wisconsin to optimize protocols for hospital turnovers as well as in support of local and national show site locations. Remote/Telecommuting permitted position -- report into company headquarters office.  Employee must be located in the Northeast United States in close proximity to a major airport - New York City, Boston, Philadelphia, Baltimore, or Washington DC.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications:

Job Description Summary

Healthcare Services Account Manager role that is customer facing, responsible for growing and winning business in an assigned geographical territory in Nashville/East Tennessee. The role is subject to regular review of sales results.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Accountable for Annual achievement of multiple sales and revenue OP targets for assigned territory.

  • Provide input to deal pricing strategy and ensure pricing compliance for segment opportunities.

  • Manage install base and drive lifecycle management.

  • Cultivating, leveraging, and developing long-term customer relationships, including "C" level and Senior VP level relationships.

  • Identify and capitalize on opportunities that satisfy customer needs.

  • Track and communicate market trends to/from the field including competitor data and develop and lead effective counterstrategies.

  • Differentiate offerings during the stages of the sales process, effectively using GEHC resources to actively support the customer through their decision-making process.

Job Description

Responsibilities

  • Responsibility for selling GE HealthCare's entire diagnostic imaging portfolio to named accounts within geography

  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with radiology stakeholders within hospitals, health systems, and imaging center account service lines (Radiology, Cardiology, Oncology, OR & Women’s Health) in order to identify qualified leads, grow market share and increase revenue, and reduce customer attrition.

  • Deliver on quarterly & annual orders and revenue sales targets; maximize profit margin on equipment and service contract sales.

  • Leverage diagnostic imaging product knowledge in MRI, Xray, CT, Interventional Radiology & Cardiology, Mammography, Nuclear Medicine & PET-C to drive funnel growth for the region.

  • Demonstrate expertise in customers’ installed base and develop technology & capital plans that map with their annual budget process.

  • Collaborate with the account community team to drive closure with site visits and co-developed negotiation strategies.

  • Reduce cycle time by leveraging Salesforce.com (CRM tool) to track customer and account activity, to map visibility and drive market share, and to prioritize sales funnel.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 3+ years of experience selling capital equipment to health systems and/or hospitals; OR High School Diploma/GED & 8 years of experience selling capital equipment to health systems and/or hospitals; OR Bachelors Degree & a graduate of GE HealthCare CLP

  • Demonstrated experience presenting complex information both verbally and written to decision makers

  • Imaging capital equipment sales experience strongly preferred

  • Must live in and be willing to travel within the territory. (Des Moines/Omaha)

  • Strong oral and written communication skills

  • Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems, manage multiple complex opportunities or projects simultaneously, and navigate complexity while driving business results.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

The Imaging Pricing Leader will play a crucial role in ensuring profitability and compliance in GE HealthCare's pricing and quoting practices. The individual will leverage critical evaluation skills to review and approve pricing for sales opportunities, managing a regional queue of quotes for escalation and approval based on discount levels, margin targets, and price performance criteria.

In this position, the Imaging Pricing Leader will ensure adherence to established business rules and industry regulations, working closely with regional leadership teams and key internal stakeholders to drive profitable pricing solutions. They will oversee the change order review process, evaluating requests for pricing modifications and contract terms & conditions adjustments.

This role requires a keen eye for detail, strong analytical abilities, and excellent collaboration skills to partner effectively with cross-functional teams. The candidate will join the Imaging Pricing Team and report directly to the USCAN Regional Pricing Manager, contributing to the overall pricing strategy and maximizing profitability across GE HealthCare's Diagnostic Imaging product portfolio.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to evaluate pricing scenarios

  • Excellent quantitative and math skills for financial modeling

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and pricing/quoting tools

  • Ability to interpret and apply pricing policies, business rules and industry regulations with diligence and integrity

  • Outstanding communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams

  • Problem-solving skills to drive profitable pricing solutions

  • Keen attention to detail in reviewing pricing proposals and contracts

  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines

  • Lead simplification efforts to improve and standardize processes to boost productivity and support business objectives

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business-related discipline

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in pricing, financial analysis or related role

  • Prior experience in the healthcare technology industry is preferred

Desired Characteristics

  • Collaborative team player with strong interpersonal skills

  • Self-motivated with ability to take initiative and make confident, informed decisions

  • Poised and assured presence when interacting with internal teams and business leaders

  • Aptitude for coaching and mentoring internal teams on pricing policies and strategies

  • Keen business acumen to drive profitability and align pricing with business objectives

  • Prior hands-on experience in pricing analysis and deal structuring

  • Understanding of the healthcare industry landscape and applicable regulations

The US government is a $100M+ a year customer with unique needs
Looking for a dynamic, problem solving leader to drive a smoother, more customer oriented process and experience for this critical customer

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Work across functional accountabilities like, order mgmt, HPM, service, gov't comm'l, A/R / collections to prevent defects and delays

  • Early success, visibility to and management of govt orders moving from order to cash collected, end to end process to reduce defects and past due amounts
  • Long term, clear standard work and continuous improvement of the end to end with the outcome of less manual interventions required
  • Problem solving mindset for the unique scenarios that arise
  • Identify issues early, and resolve escalations quickly
  • Lead daily / weekly mgmt across accountabilities for unbilled and in process billing

  • 5 years of experience in customer facing operations or processes
  • Clear strength in written and oral communication
  • Demonstrated experience leading and influencing across functions

  • Strong data driven, problem solving skill set
  • Strong active listening and customer centricity

Job Description

Essential Responsibilities

  • Accountable for Annual achievement of multiple sales and revenue OP targets for assigned territory
  • Cultivating, leveraging, and developing long-term customer relationships, including "C" level and Senior VP level relationships, coupled with the ability to identify and capitalize on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs. Identify & respond to key account technical and departmental decision makers’ needs and maintain customer contact records in the relevant CRM tools
  • Collaborate with Market Service Director and Executive Strategic Client Directors within the market to provide seamless customer service.
  • Manage operating plan objectives relative to Point of Sale (POS), Renewal (DI, CS) Warranty Conversion, Multi-Vendor Expansion, GE Winbacks, and Options and Upgrades.
  • Maintain up to date detailed knowledge of customer products and services. Be able to present and discuss the technology and clinical benefits in terms which are relevant to customers. Continuously update understanding of customers changing clinical and/or operational issues and challenges
  • Differentiate assigned product offering during the various stages of the sales process, effectively using GE resources and approved product marketing and product promotion material to actively support the customer through their decision-making process
    Represent the company at relevant medical conferences and technical exhibitions to promote product/solution and company.
  • Prospect for new customers and business in addition to growing and maintaining our existing customer portfolio.
  • Provide input to deal pricing strategy and ensure pricing compliance for segment opportunities
  • Manage install base and drive lifecycle management. Maintain strategic focus on lifecycle cost for GE equipment.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in local language
  • Ability to synthesize complex issues and communicate in simple messages
  • Excellent negotiation & closing skills
  • Strong presentation and relationship building skills
  • Ability to energize, develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization and work well within a team

  • Must be comfortable traveling roughly 3 days every other week

Desired Characteristics

  • Proven experience and success selling capital equipment and/or Service
  • Hospital executive relationship building skills
  • Excellent computer and analytical skills
  • Strong understanding on the US Healthcare system and buying groups

GE Healthcare is a place with big impact. We unlock opportunities for our people, our customers, and their patients, turning big ideas into realities that advance global healthcare.

Job Description

Esse ntial Responsibilities

  • Provide technical and clinical leadership during sales process by demonstrating full range of product features including potential uses, product capabilities and benefits to customers as needed

  • Develop, coordinate and deliver product training to customers on software, application and/or equipment use, monitor customer installations within assigned territory/region to improve customer satisfaction and maintain customer relationships

  • Improve customer satisfaction and socket retention through continuing education on optimization of equipment utilization by customer

  • Support trade shows and professional conferences by performing product demonstration and promotion as well as customer training

  • Use market and product knowledge to assist sales team in developing sales, marketing and customer service strategies

  • ARRT Certification

  • Minimum of 4 years clinical/ technical experience following certification with demonstrated clinical/technical skill in specific area. This experience should include performing C-arm procedures in most of the following areas: Operating Room, GI Lab, Pain Management, and Interventional/Cardiac Cath Lab

  • Required active professional clinical/technical certifications/registries necessary to image live patients in a clinical setting

  • Demonstrated current basic clinical scanning proficiencies on current products/platforms

  • Willingness to travel extensively within your specified geographic region as well as to nationwide sales meetings and tradeshows up to 80%/as required

  • To the extent you are applying for a position that requires you to operate a GE owned/leased, privately owned/leased or rental vehicle for company business, you must be willing to submit to a check of your driving record

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Impacts the team's ability to achieve service, quality and timeliness of objectives. Subject to Commercial policy objectives. Has independence in achieving commercial objectives within operating budgets and operating guidelines. There is moderate autonomy within the role to enter into/execute Commercial arrangements. High levels of Commercial judgment are required to achieve outcomes required.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for managing the long-term success of GE Healthcare's relationships at Mercy Health and SSM. to achieve the goals and objectives identified by the customer and GE. Drive orders and sales growth; define and implement a 1-3 year plan; develop and execute a GE Healthcare Sales strategy across the horizontal product portfolio, services, and solutions; lead and secure large, strategic, cross-P&L customer purchases; and lead the account team.
  • Requires specialized knowledge across product lines, markets, sales processes, or customer groups. Requires strong commercial awareness, and is expected to influence the development of strategy for their broad sales territory, including control of resources.
  • Interprets simple internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services. Stays informed of industry trends that may inform work.
  • Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems within projects, product lines, markets, sales processes, campaigns or customers. Has ability to assess quality of information given and ask pertinent questions to stakeholders or customers. Able to offer new solutions to problems outside of set parameters and is able to construct and provide recommendations. Uses multiple internal and some external sources outside of own function to help arrive at a decision.
  • May lead functional teams or projects with minimal resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity. Communicates difficult concepts and may influence others' options on particular topics. May guide others to consider a different point of view.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or college (or a high school diploma / GED with 6 years of sales experience in the capital sales/medical device industry.
  • Masters Degree preferred, but not required.
  • C Suite relationship experience, leading complex conversations.
  • Strong leadership of the account community preferred.
  • Ability to lead strategy and building opportunities.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead programs / projects.
  • Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs.
  • Established project management skills.
  • Travel requirement 30%
  • Territory MO, AR, OK

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

As the Territory Manager – Neurosurgery/Spine, you will be responsible for developing and executing a strategic, result oriented sales plan for BK’s intra-operative ultrasound products and services in a defined geographical territory for Neurosurgery and Spine. You will be responsible for managing existing accounts in Neurosurgery and Spine and approach your accounts methodically, building an action plan & sales pipeline based on deep intelligence gathered at accounts, accurate knowledge of capital budgeting cycles and a consultative sales approach.

BK Medical is committed to designing active imaging systems that help surgeons visualize anatomy and lesions, guide interventions, and navigate inside the human body. Our mission at BK is to change the standard of care in surgical interventions with real-time visual guidance, giving surgeons the information needed to immediately make critical decisions.

Now, BK Medical is advancing its mission with GE Healthcare. Together, we will reach more customers and continue to empower surgeons to make critical decisions that allow for better care, faster procedures, and reduced complications.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Develop in depth knowledge of all accounts/hospitals, customer groups, economic drivers, payers and providers mix in own sales territory.  Usie procedural data to help guide which accounts/hospitals are driving strong Neurosurgery programs and surgical procedures.
  • Work diligently to achieve annual, quarterly, and monthly sales targets by maintaining an accurate CRM sales funnel with detailed account information.
  • Provide National Sales Director – Neurosurgery/Spine weekly, monthly and quarterly forecasts that include rolling 6–12 month outlook.
  • Ensure consistent compliance with own CRM data, with specific focus on: sales opportunities (correct and timely staging, estimated order dates and budget amount), quoting, forecasting, win/loss analysis, competitive systems information and updated customer contacts)
  • Develop and execute action plans to drive product and service sales.  Prospect new accounts and manage existing customers with positioning of upgrades or additional Neurosurgery/Spine products or solutions.  Generate proposals, prepare sales quotations, plan customer meetings, and perform product demonstrations to showcase capabilities of ultrasound products.
  • Provide analysis to continuously develop sales territory.  Communicate gathered market intelligence, including pricing trends and competitive information, field concerns, issues, and customer requirements, through the right company channels.
  • Establish long-term customer relationships coupled with the ability to identify and capitalize on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs.  Maintain positive and productive after-sale relationships in order to periodically upsell products and services.
  • Proactively identify issues at customer sites and find resources needed to resolve them. Always leading from the front and delivering a customer experience consistent with BK Medical brand and values.
  • Prepare report(s) at manager’s request summarizing monthly sales results achieved, contacts made, hospitals visited, and new opportunities started with emphasis both on existing and competitive accounts.
  • When requested, participate in a variety of sales training and planning meetings to learn about new products and marketing promotions.

Qualifications:

  • A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent and 2-4 years or more of related experience selling capital equipment/intra-operative imaging devices and/or adjacent technologies.
  • Experience selling medical devices in an operating room, Neurosurgery, Spine or related setting. Previous healthcare ultrasound sales experience and selling to managed care / hospital organizations preferred.
  • Ability to energize, develop, and build rapport at all levels within an organization. Demonstrated ability to analyze customer data and develop financially sound sales offers.  Proven executive relationship building skills in a hospital/healthcare environment.
  • Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external customers as a part of a solution-based sales process.  Strong communication and clear-thinking skills with the ability to synthesize complex issues into simple messages.
  • Excellent oral presentation skills and the ability to think quickly to apply facts in analyzing a problem and explaining that answer to a variety of groups (OR staff, physicians, biomed, C-level).
  • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Prefers direct and honest communication with superiors, peers, and direct reports.
  • Outstanding organizational, problem solving, and multi-tasking skills.
  • High level of discipline, attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment while still maintaining a high-level of accuracy.
  • Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work with minimal supervision.
  • Travel approximately 50%

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Customer facing Clinical Sales Specialist responsible for winning Patient Monitoring business. Operates with some autonomy but typically subject to standard sales practices and procedures with a strategic emphasis on positioning our PM portfolio. The role is subject to regular review of sales results. Some judgment may be required but this is typically with guidance. Responsible for multiple Markets with several sales territories working directly with Product Sales Specialists, Strategic Directors and other supporting commercial teams.

GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Increase orders, sales, margin, and share through world-class clinical consulting, strong customer relationships, and educational support for regional sales team, local/national “show sites” and regional customer base.  These roles require specialty clinical qualifications.

  • Developing in-depth knowledge of sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups. Uses prior experience and acquired commercial expertise to execute policy/strategy.

  • In-depth understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. In-depth understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.

  • Most decisions are within a defined framework, but some autonomy in the final decisions for a project, product line, market, sales process or customers. Uses prior experience and on-the-job training to solve straightforward tasks. Has access to technical skills and analytic thinking required to solve problems. May use multiple internal sources outside of own team to arrive at decisions.

  • A job at this level is likely to be an individual contributor, with proven interpersonal skills. Communication with direct colleagues and the business about design and coordination services rendered. Provides informal guidance to new team members. Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations.

Required Qualifications:

  • This role requires advanced experience in the Sales & Clinical Sales. Required Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college and 6 years of clinical experience preferably as a Critical Care Nurse

  • Excellent Patient Monitoring Solutions product and connectivity understanding.

  • Knowledge and understanding of current healthcare market trends.

  • Superior interpersonal communication skills with exceptional professional disposition and demeanor

  • Demonstrated successful experience interfacing with both internal team members and external customers as part of a solution-based sales product portfolio and service experience.

  • Ability to develop and execute priorities and approaches to meet objectives.

Quality Specific Goals:

  • Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare HIPPA Guidelines, NEMA Regulations, etc.) and operates within them to ensure that no company policy or US / Int’l Law is broken.

  • Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or US / Int’l Law is broken.

  • Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position

  • Complete all scheduled GE Learning, Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines

  • Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required

  • Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System

Desired Characteristics:

  • Must live in territory (MA, CT, DE, NH, NY, PA, RI, or VT).

  • Strong sales, clinical and technical expertise working in PCS Monitoring Solutions.

  • Experienced in demonstrating products and solutions to a variety of healthcare audiences.

  • Entrepreneurial thinking to support customers and commercial teams in defined goal for strategic presentations and demonstrations including clinical evaluations.

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills with the ability to communicate to internal and external customers at all levels.

  • Exceptional interpersonal skills.

  • Openness to change agent and process improvement mindset.

  • Ability to understand and support the sales process.

  • Demonstration of GE Beliefs.

Job Description:
Job Description Summary

Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Jobs at this level operate with some autonomy but are covered by well-defined Commercial policies or review of end results. The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Responsible for medium-sized sales territories.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Develop and drive the regional structural heart and interventional growth strategy.
  • Create education plan and cadence for local CVUS sales and clinical applications teams on the structural heart and interventional strategy, the technologies and devices associated with each care area, and effective techniques on calling into, demoing, and closing business in this space.
  • Grow visibility and drive win rate in assigned geography/region.
  • Deliver annual orders and revenue sales targets.  Maximize profit margin on equipment and service contract sales.
  • Identify, develop and cultivate strong relationships with Key Opinion Leaders, and stakeholders, within the customer organization, many of which will be new relationships for GE Healthcare (GEHC).
  • Collaborate closely with Structural Heart Clinical Team to gain access to cases utilizing Vivid CVUS products in the Cath lab, EP lab, and/or hybrid OR.
  • Specialize in – and be willing to regularly learn, digest and utilize – Structural Heart procedures through the utilization of Cardiovascular Ultrasound.  Inclusive of transesophageal (TEE), intracardiac echo (ICE), and transthoracic echo (TTE).
  • Proactively communicate and collaborate with your account community team including Cardiology Care Leaders, CVUS Segment Leaders, Product Sales Specialists, Clinical Application Specialists, Ultrasound Account Managers, Account Executives, and Service Team.  Leverage counterparts in the Imaging and Life Care Solutions (LCS) businesses to gain access and establish customer relationships.  Drive closure with effective product demonstrations and co-developed negotiation strategy.
  • Establish strong relationship with device sales professionals that also sell, and support cases, in the structural heart, EP and OR space.  Work with these partners and our local teams to gain access to procedures, develop strong local team relationships, and establish protocols for emerging devices/procedures.
  • Work with local and virtual teams to meet in person and virtual new opportunity generation goals and move deals through sales stages:  Qualify, Quoting, Opportunity Management, Territory Management, Demo, and Lifecycle strategy alignment.
  • Leverage Salesforce.com (CRM tool) to track customer and account activity, to map visibility and drive market share.  Ability to synthesize data and respond to market changes. Flexibility and balance to thrive in a dynamic industry and market.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 5 years selling and/or clinical experience, OR an associate degree with a minimum of 10 years selling and/or clinical experience.
  • Proven experience with complex sales cycles and working in the hospital interventional environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in local language
  • Ability to develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization and work well within a team
  • Strong presentation and relationship building skills
  • Ability to synthesize complex issues and communicate in simple messages
  • Excellent negotiation & closing skills
  • Valid motor vehicle license
  • Must be willing to live within the territory
  • You must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction
  • Ability to travel 50-75% of time within region.

Desired Characteristics

  • Strong customer relationships in assigned territory
  • Previous experience in the Healthcare industry
  • Proven experience, and success selling/supporting capital equipment, or devices, in the interventional cardiac space
  • Technical and/or clinical imaging product knowledge, preferably with an Ultrasound background
  • Desire to learn and adapt to win in a rapidly evolving environment
  • Excellent computer and analytical skills
  • Strong understanding on the US Healthcare system and buying group
